chunk-22376ad0f4b05f5f20412a982321c613.description: Carreras et al. won the CoNLL 2002 competition using binary AdaBoost classifiers and achieved high F-scores on Spanish and Dutch CoNLL 2002 datasets.
Li et al. implemented an SVM model on the CoNLL 2003 dataset and CMU seminar documents, achieving an 88.3% F score on the English CoNLL 2003 data.
Takeuchi and Collier used SVM with various features on the MUC6 data and decided the final tag by voting of multiple one-vs-one SVM outputs.
Segura Bedmar et al. achieved state-of-the-art results in DrugNER by using a CRF with features like lexicon resources and word embeddings.
Liu et al. achieved state-of-the-art results in DrugNER by using a CRF with features like lexicon resources and word embeddings.
Rocktäschel et al. used a CRF with features constructed from dictionaries, ontologies, and prefixes-suffixes from chemical entities for the DrugNER task.
Collobert and Weston proposed one of the first neural network architectures for NER, later replaced manually constructed feature vectors with word embeddings.
Jochem, along with Hettne et al., is associated with lexicon resources used in the DrugNER task.
Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN) are used in word-level architectures for NER, with each word represented by its word embedding.

chunk-7fb7bd65b722433093ae9f1c85b9fe4e.description: Lample et al. introduced a model architecture that achieved high F scores on multiple language NER datasets from CoNLL 2002 and 2003.
Santos and Guimaraes implemented a model that achieved high F scores on Spanish CoNLL 2002 data and Portuguese NER data.
NeuroNER is a toolkit for named entity recognition models, integrated with the BRAT annotation tool for ease of development, and achieved a high F score on the English CoNLL 2003 data.
GRU is a type of RNN cell used by Yang et al. for word representation in their multi-task and multi-lingual joint learning system.
LSTM-B stands for Long Short-Term Memory model with a backward look, used in NER architectures.
LSTM-F stands for Long Short-Term Memory model with a forward look, used in NER architectures.
CRF refers to Conditional Random Fields, a model used in various NER systems for predicting entity labels.

chunk-cf36c8fd2948cda996a7b1897c0e732d.description: CoNLL 2002 and 2003 are events where named entity recognition systems were evaluated on Spanish, Dutch, English, and German datasets.
DrugNER is the event from SemEval 2013 task 9 where named entity recognition systems were evaluated on the dataset provided by DrugNER organization.
MedLine and DrugBank are geo-locations where test data for the DrugNER dataset was collected.
Agerri and Rigau, also known as Rodrigo Agerri and German Rigau, are authors who presented a feature-engineered system for Spanish and German named entity recognition in 2016.
CoNLL Datasets refer to the collections of data used for evaluating named entity recognition systems in various languages during the CoNLL events.
Spanish, Dutch, English, and German refer to the language datasets used in the CoNLL events for named entity recognition tasks.
